subject: AI & Agents
title: What Makes AI 'Generative'?
description: A quick, practical guide to What Makes AI 'Generative'?.

hook.text: Traditional AI classifies cats vs dogs. Generative AI creates a new cat that never existed.

buildup.text: Generative models learn the distribution of training data, then sample new examples from it.

discovery.text: They produce: text, images, audio, video, code, 3D models, and even molecules.

twist.text: Generation looks creative but it's pattern interpolationâ€”remixing learned structures.

climax.text: The breakthrough: models large enough to generate coherent, high-quality output at scale.

punchline.text: Not intelligence. Pattern synthesis at scale.

quiz.question: What does a generative model learn?
options: The distribution of training data to sample new examples
